Name: Name Unknown
TDoR list ref: tdor.info/11 Jul 2007/Unidentified Male Clad in Female Attire
Description:
The victim died from gunshot wounds to the chest and lower back.

The Matilda’s Corner Police, in Kingston Jamaica, found a male body clad in female attire – a jeans skirt, panty and a brief.  The victim was killed and the body dumped in the St. Andrew Central Police division on Wednesday, July 11, 2007 — Investigators say the victim was killed elsewhere and the body dumped along Munroe Road. 

The unidentified victim had gunshot wounds to the chest and lower back.  Police sources theorized that the killing may have been a hate crime.

Name: Victoria Arellano
Description:
Victoria was an undocumented immigrant detained by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) in May.

She had HIV, and according to published reports ICE officials routinely denied her the antibiotic dapasone and other necessary medications to treat HIV-related side effects.

> During detention in San Pedro, attorneys said, her AIDS treatment lapsed. As she vomited blood, fellow inmates cared for her in vain. She was eventually taken to a San Pedro hospital and died while shackled to a bed, an attorney for the family said. 

Following her death her mother Olga spoke out about how ICE has let her daughter die.

> Olga Arellano spoke at a rally at the Federal Building in downtown Los Angeles on Aug. 27 about how her 23-year-old daughter, Victoria, died July 20 at an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) federal detention facility in South Los Angeles.
> 
> “I can only find the strength to talk about this because I want people to know what is going on inside that place,” Olga Arellano stated. “I don’t want another family to have to live through this nightmare.” (Daily Journal, Aug. 9)
> 
> Authorities reportedly refused to give Victoria Arellano—an undocumented Mexican trans woman with AIDS—urgently needed medical attention and her critically necessary prescribed antibiotic, despite mass protests on her behalf by other immigrant detainees. Authorities had imprisoned her since May in a men’s mass detention cell.

Name: Oscar Mosqueda
Description:
Oscar was shot to death outside Pasta Amore, in Daytona Beach, Florida. At the time they were dressed in a mini-skirt and high heels.

Cesar Israel Villazano, confessed to police that he shot Oscar. Villazano claimed he killed Oscar after Oscar made an embarrassing sexual advance, but the witness Wesley Rosser told police Oscar died defending a friend.

One bullet hit Oscar in the head; Oscar died later that Sunday at Halifax Medical Center.

> Daytona Beach police arrested two men in connection with a killing Sunday, just hours after they responded to what initially appeared to be a hit and-run accident.
>
> Police were called to the 1200 block of North Nova Road about 3:30 a.m. and found Oscar Mosqueda, 34, on the ground. Mosqueda had suffered a gunshot wound to the head and was taken to Halifax Hospital, where he later died.
>
> About noon, a Volusia County deputy sheriff stopped a blue Honda Accord matching the description of the vehicle at the scene of the earlier call. Interviews revealed that Mosqueda and Israel Villazano, a passenger in the car, had argued before the shooting. Police searched the car and found a gun they think was used in the shooting.
>
> Villazano, 18, of DeLand, was arrested on a charge of second-degree murder. The car's driver, 21-year-old Luis Acosta of DeLand, was arrested on a charge of possession of cocaine. Both were booked into Volusia County Branch Jail on Sunday.
